alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 6:06AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD SNOW FOR THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND MATANUSKA VALLEY TODAY. AREAS OF BLOWING SNOW LIKELY FOR THE ANCHORAGE HILLSIDE AND TURNAGAIN ARM... Light snow will develop across the Anchorage Bowl and Matanuska Valley this morning. The snow will become steadier by noon with gusty southeasterly winds likely through Turnagain Arm and across Anchorage Hillside. Gusts to 35 mph are possible, resulting in localized areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility, especially along the Seward Highway. Bands of heavier snow, with snowfall rates of one inch per hour, are also possible between 2 pm and 5 pm this afternoon. Any heavy snow during this time could result in reduced visibilities and may impact the evening commute. A total of 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected with totals up to 6 inches for the Anchorage Hillside and areas north of Wasilla and Palmer. Snow will taper off Friday evening.
